TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit TcpStatistics extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) statistical data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Instances of this class are returned by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPGlobalProperties.GetTcpIPv4Statistics%2A> and <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPGlobalProperties.GetTcpIPv6Statistics%2A> methods, to give applications access to TCP traffic information.
The information in this class correlates to the management information objects described in [https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2012.txt](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2012.txt).
## Examples The following code example displays the TCP statistics for the specified address family.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfoReport#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfoReport/CPP/netinfo.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfoReport#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfoReport/CS/netinfo.cs#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor can be called only by classes that derive from the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.TcpStatistics> class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ConnectionsAccepted As Long
public: abstract property long ConnectionsAccepted { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of accepted Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connection requests.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of TCP connection requests accepted.

remarks.format:
## Remarks IETF RFC 2012 formally defines this value as, "The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state."
## Examples The following code example displays connection information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#6)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#6)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ConnectionsInitiated As Long
public: abstract property long ConnectionsInitiated { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connection requests made by clients.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of TCP connections initiated by clients.

remarks.format:
## Remarks IETF RFC 2012 formally defines this value as, "The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state."
## Examples The following code example displays connection information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#6)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#6)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property CumulativeConnections As Long
public: abstract property long CumulativeConnections { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Specifies the total number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connections established.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of connections established.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example displays connection information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#6)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#6)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property CurrentConnections As Long
public: abstract property long CurrentConnections { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of current Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connections.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of current TCP connections.

remarks.format:
## Remarks IETF RFC 2012 formally defines this value as, "The number of TCP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT."
## Examples The following code example displays connection information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#6)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#6)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ErrorsReceived As Long
public: abstract property long ErrorsReceived { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) errors received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of TCP errors received.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example displays connection information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#6)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#6)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property FailedConnectionAttempts As Long
public: abstract property long FailedConnectionAttempts { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of failed Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connection attempts.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of failed TCP connection attempts.

remarks.format:
## Remarks IETF RFC 2012 formally defines this value as, "The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SYN-SENT state or the SYN-RCVD state, plus the number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the LISTEN state from the SYN-RCVD state."
## Examples The following code example displays connection information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#6)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#6)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property MaximumConnections As Long
public: abstract property long MaximumConnections { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum number of supported Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connections.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of TCP connections that can be supported.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the maximum number of connections is dynamic, this property returns -1.
## Examples The following code example displays time-out and maximum connection information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#5](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#5)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#5)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property MaximumTransmissionTimeout As Long
public: abstract property long MaximumTransmissionTimeout { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum retransmission time-out value for Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) segments.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the maximum number of milliseconds permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission time-out value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks TCP starts a retransmission timer when each outbound segment is passed to the network layer (IP). If no acknowledgement is received for the data in the segment before the timer expires, the segment is retransmitted. The timer can be set to any value between the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.TcpStatistics.MinimumTransmissionTimeout%2A> value and the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.TcpStatistics.MaximumTransmissionTimeout%2A> value.
## Examples The following code example displays time-out and maximum connection information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#5](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#5)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#5)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property MinimumTransmissionTimeout As Long
public: abstract property long MinimumTransmissionTimeout { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the minimum retransmission time-out value for Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) segments.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the minimum number of milliseconds permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission time-out value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks TCP starts a retransmission timer when each outbound segment is passed to the network layer (IP). If no acknowledgement is received for the data in the segment before the timer expires, the segment is retransmitted. The timer The timer can be set to any value between the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.TcpStatistics.MinimumTransmissionTimeout%2A> value and the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.TcpStatistics.MaximumTransmissionTimeout%2A> value.
## Examples The following code example displays time-out and maximum connection information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#5](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#5)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#5)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ResetConnections As Long
public: abstract property long ResetConnections { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of RST packets received by Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connections.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of reset TCP connections.

remarks.format:
## Remarks IETF RFC 2012 formally defines this value as, "The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the ESTABLISHED state or the CLOSE-WAIT state."
## Examples The following code example displays connection information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#6)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#6)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ResetsSent As Long
public: abstract property long ResetsSent { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) segments sent with the reset flag set.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of TCP segments sent with the reset flag set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks TCP resets are specified using the reset (RST) control bit in the TCP header.
## Examples The following code example displays segment information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#7](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#7)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#7)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#7)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property SegmentsReceived As Long
public: abstract property long SegmentsReceived { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) segments received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of TCP segments received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This data includes segments with errors and segments received on currently established connections.
## Examples The following code example displays segment information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#7](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#7)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#7)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#7)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property SegmentsResent As Long
public: abstract property long SegmentsResent { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) segments re-sent.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of TCP segments retransmitted.

remarks.format:
## Remarks TCP segments that are not acknowledged as being received at the destination are retransmitted.
## Examples The following code example displays segment information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#7](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#7)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#7)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#7)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property SegmentsSent As Long
public: abstract property long SegmentsSent { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) segments sent.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of TCP segments sent.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This data includes segments sent for currently established connections but does not include segments containing only retransmitted octets.
## Examples The following code example displays segment information.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#7](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#7)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#7)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#7)]
